Keywords: Ruler
Real Name: Felicia Hardy
Special Powers
BLACK CAT'S FORMING A GANG: When establishing themed teams, Black Cat gains the named keyword of another character on your starting force.
EXPERT CAT BURGLAR: Leap/Climb, Sidestep, Stealth.
BAD LUCK FIELD: Opposing characters within 4 squares can't use Probability Control to reroll attack rolls that contain a 1 or 2.

Comments
December 21, 2021
Disasstah
[QUOTE=fastcat99;12072410]I really enjoyed playing with this piece. Very useful if you have some scattered hindering that she can jump into and out of. Such an odd piece, though, just because of the keyword. However, I have a question about that...Because it says 'when establishing theme teams'...does that mean I can only pick a keyword if I have some sort of a theme team? During the sealed event, I pulled all kinds of mismatch, so can I assign her a named keyword even as i'm establishing that I don't have a named theme team? I'm thinking 'establish' could mean i 'establish' that I don't have a theme team.[/QUOTE] @fastcat99 23.2a Determining Themed Teams In order for a starting force to become a themed team, when you reveal your force during step 1 of Game Setup, you must choose a single keyword that all characters on your starting force share. If all your characters share more than one keyword, pick only one. Establishing a theme team means everyone shares a keyword. You can't establish that you're not making a theme team. As for this piece, she gets to pick a keyword during this process and if everyone share the same keyword it's a themed team. Otherwise I don't think she gets the keyword. Probably something we'd have to ask in the rules forums. I like the piece as she can fit on any team but she's mostly a fun filler. Great for helping deny prob control and an excellent transporter. She's also great for tie up as long as you can remove any outwits that would deny her combat reflexes. Overall a great control board control piece who can make it difficult for your opponent to position.
October 3, 2020
mc268
Really good for the cost on any team, can carry 1-2 characters, great stats, stealth and combat reflexes, not to mention sidestep and leap climb. Capable of dealing pretty great damage. Her damage power is interesting, it can be anywhere from game changing to irrelevant depending on your opponents rolls, but it forces them to position away from her if they donâ€™t want to risk it. The end dial prob is nice.
September 19, 2020
tyroclix
WIN/LOSS: 1-0 Felicia here is a nice cost with some offensive teeth. P-Strike and the 11 attack with consistent 3 damage is strong - and her mobility is fantastic. Her main role is taxi and she does excel at that (giving wildcards the knuckleduster TA, too) - even though that feels strange to think Black Cat = awesome taxi. Her special damage is a nice attempt at flavor but ultimately falls flat given her short area of effect and the rarity of the roll happening. Ideally, Felicia will carry in someone - basing a target - and then attempt to weather the storm. Giving her PC via an object is a consideration since her cost is so low - otherwise I find her just an okay piece.
September 17, 2020
fastcat99
I really enjoyed playing with this piece. Very useful if you have some scattered hindering that she can jump into and out of. Such an odd piece, though, just because of the keyword. However, I have a question about that...Because it says 'when establishing theme teams'...does that mean I can only pick a keyword if I have some sort of a theme team? During the sealed event, I pulled all kinds of mismatch, so can I assign her a named keyword even as i'm establishing that I don't have a named theme team? I'm thinking 'establish' could mean i 'establish' that I don't have a theme team.
